PARTICULAR.Definition: special, or this and not any other

ANYWAY.Definition: in conversation, anyway is also used to change the subject, return to an earlier subject, or get to the most interesting point

DESCRIBING.Definition: to say or write what someone or something is like

INSECURE.Definition: (of people) lacking confidence and doubting their own abilities

ON TOP OF THAT.Definition: in addition to something, especially something unpleasant

RUIN.Definition: to spoil or destroy something completely

VOCABULARY.Definition: all the words used by a particular person, or all the words that exist in a particular language or subject

EXPANSIVE.Definition: marked by expansion especially : having a great expanse or extent : sizable, extensive

NEVER MIND.Definition: used to tell someone not to worry about something because it is not important

UP FOR.Definition: intended, suggested, or being considered for something

NO BIG DEAL.Definition: used to indicate that something is of little consequence

ENGAGED.Definition: to become involved, or have contact, with someone or something

VISION.Definition: an idea or mental image of something

MAKING SENSE.Definition: to be clear and easy to understand

GET UP.Definition: to wake up and get out of bed, or to tell or help someone to do this

EMBARRASSED.Definition: to cause someone to feel nervous, worried, or uncomfortable

IMPRESSIVE.Definition: if someone is impressive, you admire or respect that person for their special skills or abilities

VISUALIZATION.Definition: the act of visualizing something or someone (= forming a picture of it in your mind)
